headline.main: OLD FOLKS' DINNER A SUCCESS IN HOTEL; " Home, Sweet Home" Vanquishes the Tango at the Bonta-Narragansett.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sunday evening dinners, interspersed with sacred music and intimate discussions of appropriate subjects, recalling the Sundays spent with the old folks at home, were begun by the Hotel Bonta-Narragansett, Broadway and Ninety-fourth Street, yesterday with a success that was not hoped for by the management. The number of diners was more than double that of last Sunday, in spite of the bad weather.
docs.snippet: Sunday evening dinners, interspersed with sacred music and intimate discussions of appropriate subjects, recalling the Sundays spent with the old folks at home, were begun by the Hotel Bonta-Narragansett, Broadway and Ninety-fourth Street, yesterd...

headline.main: WANTS LABOR LAW MADE MORE ELASTIC; State Commissioner Tells Investigating Board He Needs More Authority.

docs.abstract: testifies before State Factory Investigating Commission, advocates changes in labor law, needs more authority, can't enforce sanitation
docs.lead_paragraph: James M. Lynch, the State Labor Commissioner, in testifying before the Factory Investigating Committee in the County Court House yesterday, advocated many changes in the labor law to give the statute more elasticity. Many complaints made now against his department would be obviated, he said if he was able to apply the spirit as well as the letter of the law.
docs.snippet: James M. Lynch, the State Labor Commissioner, in testifying before the Factory Investigating Committee in the County Court House yesterday, advocated many changes in the labor law to give the statute more elasticity. Many complaints made now again...

headline.main: TOO MANY LONDON HOTELS.; So Says Earl of Bessborough -- Motors Cause of Short Stays of Guests.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.abstract: Earl of Bessborough declares there are too many hotels in London, annual meeting, Gordon Hotels Co
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 23. -- The Earl of Bessborough, presiding to-day at the annual meeting of the Gordon Hotels Company, took a very pessimistic view of the London hotel situation. Except perhaps for a few weeks in the very height of the season, said he, London had too many hotels, and competition had become very severe.

headline.main: THE HOTEL MAN'S RIGHT TO INTRUDE; He May Enter Any Guest's Room, Says Court, Ruling Under 300-Year-Old Law. ONE JUSTICE DISSENTS McLaughlin Calls Reasoning of His Appellate Associates Absurd -- Decision In Grand Union Case.

docs.abstract: NYS Sup Ct Appellate Div Judge Ingraham decision upholds hotel proprietor's right to enter guests' rooms; cites 300-yr-old Brit ct decision in denying Mrs C DeWolf's $10,000 suit against NYC Grand Union Hotel
docs.lead_paragraph: In a decision sustaining the court below, the Appellate Division decided yesterday that a hotel proprietor could not be held in damages for invasion of the privacy of a guest's room. The opinion was written by Justice Ingraham, and Justices Lambert, Patterson, and Clarke concurred.
